snippet: The defense ministers of India and China agreed Tuesday to resume joint military exercises, which were frozen two years ago, signaling a thaw in relations.
abstract: Defense ministers of India and China agree to resume joint military exercises, which were frozen in 2010, signaling a thaw in relations between the two countries.
lead_paragraph: The defense ministers of India and China agreed Tuesday to resume joint military exercises, which were frozen two years ago, signaling a thaw in relations.

headline.seo: India and China Agree to Resume Joint Military Exercises
headline.main: India and China Agree to Resume Joint Military Exercises
headline.print_headline: After Two Years, India and China Agree to Resume Joint Military Exercises
